Riot boosting isn’t happening in South Dakota, and it’s not an excuse to stifle free speech.

Stand against anti-free speech policies.

We need you with us on the frontlines. Join the volunteer and action team!

SIGN UP TODAY

Dear ##SM_RULE_360 Email Salutation##,

The right to join with your friends and neighbors in protest or peaceful assembly is critical to a functioning democracy and a right guaranteed by the Constitution.

That's why we're taking South Dakota to court.

We filed a federal lawsuit this week challenging South Dakota laws that threaten criminal and civil penalties for protesters and social justice organizations that encourage organized protests, including those that could occur around the Keystone XL Pipeline. These laws, which include the newly-enacted “Riot Boosting” Act, violate the First and Fourteenth Amendments.

No one should have to fear the government coming after them for exercising their First Amendment rights. We're prepared to stand on the front lines and defend your right to peacefully protest and express your opinions freely.

We hope you'll join our efforts to fight back as an ACLU legal observer, volunteer, or supporter.

Our voices won't be silenced. Will yours?

In Liberty,

Heather Smith
Executive Director, ACLU of South Dakota
